meanings.definition: Conforming to a standard or set of standards.
meanings.sent1: The teacher required all students to use standardised paper for their assignments.
meanings.sent2: The company implemented standardised procedures to ensure consistency in their products.
meanings.sent3: The standardised test was so predictable that even the class clown aced it.
meanings.sent4: Her standardised approach to problem-solving made her the go-to person in the team.
meanings.sent5: The standardised color-coding system helped everyone easily identify the different components.

meanings.definition: To make something conform to a standard.
meanings.sent1: The manufacturer standardised the packaging to meet industry regulations.
meanings.sent2: She standardised the font size across all documents for better readability.
meanings.sent3: He jokingly standardised his morning routine to include exactly three cups of coffee.
meanings.sent4: The coach standardised the training program to improve the team's performance.
meanings.sent5: The chef standardised the recipe to ensure consistent taste in every dish.

meanings.definition: Established or widely accepted as a model or example.
meanings.sent1: The standardised design of the logo became instantly recognizable.
meanings.sent2: Her standardised approach to customer service set a new benchmark in the industry.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's standardised jokes always left the audience in stitches.
meanings.sent4: His standardised leadership style inspired trust and loyalty among his team.
meanings.sent5: The standardised safety protocols prevented accidents in the workplace.
